verses.verse: For the Chief Musician; set to Shoshannim. A Psalm of the sons of Korah. Maschil. A Song of loves. My heart <S%H3820><s%> overfloweth <S%H7370><s%> with a goodly <S%H2896><s%> matter <S%H1697><s%>; I speak <S%H559><s%> the things which I have made <S%H4639><s%> touching the king <S%H4428><s%>: My tongue <S%H3956><s%> is the pen <S%H5842><s%> of a ready <S%H4106><s%> writer <S%H5608><s%>.

Thou art fairer <S%H3302><s%> than the children <S%H1121><s%> of men <S%H120><s%>; Grace <S%H2580><s%> is poured <S%H3332><s%> into thy lips <S%H8193><s%>: Therefore God <S%H430><s%> hath blessed <S%H1288><s%> thee for ever <S%H5769><s%>.
Gird <S%H2296><s%> thy sword <S%H2719><s%> upon thy thigh <S%H3409><s%>, O mighty <S%H1368><s%> one <S%H1935><s%>, Thy glory and thy majesty <S%H1926><s%>.

And in thy majesty <S%H1926><s%> ride <S%H7392><s%> on prosperously <S%H6743><s%>, Because <S%H1697><s%> of truth <S%H571><s%> and meekness <S%H6037><s%> and righteousness <S%H6664><s%>: And thy right hand <S%H3225><s%> shall teach <S%H3384><s%> thee terrible things <S%H3372><s%>.
Thine arrows <S%H2671><s%> are sharp <S%H8150><s%>; The peoples <S%H5971><s%> fall <S%H5307><s%> under thee <S%H3820><s%>; They are in the heart of the king <S%H4428><s%>'s enemies <S%H341><s%>.

Thy throne <S%H3678><s%>, O God <S%H430><s%>, is for ever <S%H5769><s%> and ever <S%H5703><s%>: A sceptre <S%H7626><s%> of equity <S%H4334><s%> is the sceptre <S%H7626><s%> of thy kingdom <S%H4438><s%>.

Thou hast loved <S%H157><s%> righteousness <S%H6664><s%>, and hated <S%H8130><s%> wickedness <S%H7562><s%>: Therefore God <S%H430><s%>, thy God <S%H430><s%>, hath anointed <S%H4886><s%> thee With the oil <S%H8081><s%> of gladness <S%H8342><s%> above thy fellows <S%H2270><s%>.

All thy garments <S%H899><s%> smell of myrrh <S%H4753><s%>, and aloes <S%H174><s%>, and cassia <S%H7102><s%>; Out of ivory <S%H8127><s%> palaces <S%H1964><s%> stringed <S%H4482><s%> instruments have made thee glad <S%H8055><s%>.

Kings <S%H4428><s%>' daughters <S%H1323><s%> are among thy honorable women <S%H3368><s%>: At thy right hand <S%H3225><s%> doth stand <S%H5324><s%> the queen <S%H7694><s%> in gold <S%H3800><s%> of Ophir <S%H211><s%>.

Hearken <S%H8085><s%>, O daughter <S%H1323><s%>, and consider <S%H7200><s%>, and incline <S%H5186><s%> thine ear <S%H241><s%>; Forget <S%H7911><s%> also thine own people <S%H5971><s%>, and thy father <S%H1><s%>'s house <S%H1004><s%>:
So will the king <S%H4428><s%> desire <S%H183><s%> thy beauty <S%H3308><s%>; For he is thy lord <S%H113><s%>; And reverence thou him <S%H7812><s%>.

And the daughter <S%H1323><s%> of Tyre <S%H6865><s%> shall be there with a gift <S%H4503><s%>; The rich <S%H6223><s%> among the people <S%H5971><s%> shall entreat <S%H2470><s%> thy favor <S%H6440><s%>.
The king <S%H4428><s%>'s daughter <S%H1323><s%> within <S%H6441><s%> the palace is all glorious <S%H3520><s%>: Her clothing <S%H3830><s%> is inwrought <S%H4865><s%> with gold <S%H2091><s%>.

She shall be led <S%H2986><s%> unto the king <S%H4428><s%> in broidered work <S%H7553><s%>: The virgins <S%H1330><s%> her companions <S%H7464><s%> that follow <S%H310><s%> her Shall be brought unto thee <S%H935><s%>.
With gladness <S%H8057><s%> and rejoicing <S%H1524><s%> shall they be led <S%H2986><s%>: They shall enter <S%H935><s%> into the king <S%H4428><s%>'s palace <S%H1964><s%>.
Instead of thy fathers <S%H1><s%> shall be thy children <S%H1121><s%>, Whom thou shalt make <S%H7896><s%> princes <S%H8269><s%> in all the earth <S%H776><s%>.

I will make thy name <S%H8034><s%> to be remembered <S%H2142><s%> in all <S%H1755><s%> generations <S%H1755><s%>: Therefore shall the peoples <S%H5971><s%> give thee thanks <S%H3034><s%> for ever <S%H5769><s%> and ever <S%H5769><s%>.
